results.title: A Visit to a sheep farm
results.creator_credit: Gibson Film Productions and Dell King
results.brief_description:
An overview of activities on a sheep farm, following two children on a tour. Shows rounding up, tail docking, shearing, different fleece types, and takes a quick look at the process of converting raw wool into marketable commodities.
Shitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: A Visit to a ....: a sheep farm, a dairy, an airport, a container port
results.creator_credit: Gibson Film Productions, Dell King, Dave Gibson and Yvonne MacKay
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing programs about two children who visit a dairy farm, a sheep farm, an airport and a container port. Reveals the daily and seasonal life of each venue.

results.title: A Visit from St Nicholas: a Coronet fantasy
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and David A. Smart
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of “Twas the night before Christmas” by Clement Clarke Moore executed in a simple limited animation style including 3-D objects and cut-out animation techniques.

results.title: A Visit from space
results.brief_description: Animated film about the adventures of a little girl who meets an inhabitant of a distant planet. It is based on the new world of space as seen through the fantasy of a modern child.

results.title: A Visit from Captain Cook
results.creator_credit: Peter Jones, ONF | NFB and Colin Brown
results.brief_description: When world-famous explorer James Cook took to the high seas in the 1700s he had ships’ artists accompany him to record first-hand the people and events in the far-away lands he visited. Cook’s stopovers among the Nootka Indians on the west coast of Vancouver Island are featured in this film that uses old paintings to recreate his search for a northwest passage to the Orient. Voice and narration: Sam Payne.

results.title: A Village school
results.creator_credit: Colonial Film Unit and Great Britain. Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: A study of the school at Ashley Green, in Buckinghamshire, England during World War II, when it was greatly enlarged to cater for children evacuated from London and other big cities.

results.title: A View to a kill (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: John Glen, Michael G. Wilson, Albert R. Broccoli and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
With a pre-title sequence involving impressive Arctic down hill skiing cum snowboarding (complete with a Beach Boys track), “A View to a kill” marks the final appearance of Roger Moore as Secret Agent 007. When the body of 003 is found concealed beneath the ice, he has in his possession a precious microchip - one impervious to the magnetic force of a nuclear explosion. What’s special about the chip however is that the KGB chip is a perfect replica of one designed in the West by Zorin Industries; someone has been leaking secrets to the Soviets. Head of the industry is Frenchman Max Zorin (a fiendish Christopher Walken who revels in his villainous persona), ably assisted by his right hand “man” May Day (Grace Jones). Zorin’s plan is to take a stranglehold of the International microchip cartel by ridding himself of rival manufacturers - mainly contained within California’s Silicone Valley - thanks to a series of strategically placed explosions along the San Andreas Fault. James goes after Zorin in a trans-continental journey from England to France then America where the film climaxes in a blimp over the Golden Gate Bridge. Notable action sequences include an Eiffel Tower chase, a deadly car wash, a competitive steeplechase and a fiery elevator and fire engine. Tanya Roberts stars as Bond girl seismologist Stacey Sutton.

results.title: A Very sheepish affair
results.creator_credit: Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Anroste Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 37 of Series “Dodo, the kid from outer space”
Professor Fingers has invented a new sheep shearing machine that gives a really close shave. Unfortunately he tests it in the middle of zero degrees temperatures and the sheep are suffering. Dodo steps in to help the Professor make amends.

results.title: A Very delicate matter (short version)
results.creator_credit: Patrick McCormick, Highgate Pictures and Claude Kerven
results.brief_description: A narrative which highlights the importance of honesty in sexual relationships where venereal disease is concerned. Stresses the responsibility to inform other sexual partners if one discovers one has the disease and indicates the possible consequences of the disease if it is left unchecked.
